meanings.definition: To charge with the fault, offense, or crime
meanings.sent1: She was accusing her brother of breaking the vase.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was accusing the student of cheating on the test.
meanings.sent3: The cat was accusing the dog of stealing its toy.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were accusing the sky of hiding the sun.
meanings.sent5: The detective's accusing gaze made the suspect nervous.

meanings.sent1: He kept accusing his friend of being late.
meanings.sent2: The manager was accusing the employee of making mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The child was accusing the toy of not working properly.
meanings.sent4: The wind was accusing the tree of bending too easily.
meanings.sent5: Her accusing tone made him realize his mistake.
